name: Country Inn & Suites By Carlson, San Diego North

reviews.text: I needed a room near UCSD to move my son out of his dorm. This was a very nice hotel with inside corridors which felt very safe. Inviting reception area complete with fresh coffee and cookies , as well as, friendly staff. Room was clean and spacious with fridge and micro. There is a Chilis restaurant next door. Close to freeway 805.
reviews.title: Minutes to UCSD

reviews.text: Nice hotel in convenient location, a few miles from UCSD. Excellent service from all the staff. Clean rooms with comfortable furnishings. Good variety of hot and cold breakfast food, though the breakfast area was extremely busy and the staff was a bit challenged keeping everything well stocked. Appreciated coffee, tea and water available 24/7 in the lobby.
reviews.title: Cookies and more!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The pool area is pleasant. We had a large group of family in town for graduation, and really great to have public areas to congregate, at the pool or in the fireplace lounge area. We were wishing the lobby bar was open, but it seemed to be closed all the nights we were there. Still the well furnished lounge area was the perfect gathering spot for our friends and relatives to socialize.
reviews.title: Country Inn & Suites San Diego

reviews.text: Since I was the family member to select this hotel for everyone, I was greatly relieved that it was such a nice property. We all enjoyed our stay. And oh yes, those yummy cookies were very popular!
reviews.title: Top Notch & Convenient

reviews.text: My husband and I have stayed here numerous times. It is conveniently located off the 805 freeway, near Qualcomm and other companies, and it is easy to get to local attractions from the hotel. The service in the hotel is excellent; there is a nice outdoor pool and indoor exercise room. The complimentary breakfast of hot and cold items is very good. There is a Chili's restaurant adjacent to the hotel.
reviews.title: Clean with Perfect Location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We spent 3 nights here after a conference in downtown San Diego. We switched to Country Inn and Suites because the price was excellent and it is not very far from downtown. The breakfast was great and I loved the fire place with an area to sit, relax and visit.
reviews.title: Excellent place to stay

reviews.text: Room accomodations were very nice without the high price!
reviews.title: As good as the ratings

reviews.text: Some times I read ratings on various travel or restaurant sites, and I get mixed signals. Is the place being reviewed as good as they said, or, in some cases as lousy as described. This hotel is great. The very best in it's price range. Free Parking. Free Internet. Free Breakfast. I'll stay here again.
reviews.title: Enjoyed Our Stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We spent 2 nights while watching 2 grandsons play in a water polo tournament that took place at 5 venues the hotel was centrally located and convenient to all. The breakfast was included and had very good selections. The staff was excellent and were extremely tolerant of all the young water polo players conversing in the lobby gathering hall. The room was spacious and reasonably priced. A very good experience.
reviews.title: As good as it gets!

reviews.text: A lovely property, tastefully decorated throughout and having the advantage of a restaurant and bar on site. Staff were friendly and efficient.The room was modern, comfortable and quiet. The complementary breakfast was excellent. We ate locally at the Wine Seller & Brasserie and, although a little difficult to find, was well worth seeking out.
reviews.title: Enjoyable getaway

reviews.text: I stayed here for 2 weeks during my business trip and can't complain about anything - nice staff, clean, spacious, filling breakfast. It's close enough to highway to be minutes away from anything, there's Chili's restaurant just outside if you're lazy to drive elsewhere, and there's a bunch of places to shop down Mira Mesa boulevard. Just make sure you live above 2nd floor if you don't want to stare at AC units.
reviews.title: Nice play to stay in Mira Mesa / Miramar area

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This is the second time my wife and I stayed at this hotel. I am very pleased. It's located in Mira Mesa, which is about 10-15 minutes north east from downtown San Diego. It is conveniently located by surrounding cities. The room was thoroughly clean, the break buffet has a lot of great choices.(scramble eggs, bacon sausage patty, hash browns, fresh fruit, waffle station and variety of juices). Free Parking, Very Comfortable mattress, and affordable prices.
reviews.title: Excellent Experience

reviews.text: A very good value for the area. Always quiet and the staff is excellent, including the same gentleman that prepares the morning buffet. The staff goes out of their way to make you feel welcome. Free parking, breakfast and internet! Good value.
reviews.title: Really good value

reviews.text: I have stayed here several times for business - the hotel is nice and the staff is very professional - the breakfast buffet is very good and the 24/7 coffee/water is a nice touch. I have to say Chris, the bartender and lounge host, is very good - remembers my name, delivers quality service and always very professional yet friendly. Location is very good - you can take a walk or a short drive to areas of interest. Easy access to the main highways. i will stay here again - and recommend it to others. Thank you !
reviews.title: Quality Service at a value price

reviews.text: I traveled to San Diego in March and I booked this hotel through Expedia. I was a little skeptical after I read the reviews on this site about this hotel but I booked the hotel anyway after a long search for other convenient hotels around the area. To my surprise, I found this hotel to be very good and the staff very attentive to our needs. It was located not too far away from the airport ( 16 miles) and other major attractions in the city (Sea World-14 miles, Legoland 20 miles approximately by car). My family and I enjoyed having breakfast at their restaurant every morning. The staff was very helpful and our room was very clean. I will definitely come back to this hotel when I travel to San DIego.
reviews.title: Great Hotel!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The location was perfect for all the best places near La Jolla. The rates can't be beat! You have the check this place out. Super clean rooms and the breakfast was different every day with many hot dish choices.... Way beyond the continental choices most other places serve. Overall very relaxing place for adults or kids with a great atmosphere.
reviews.title: Fantastic location, rates, and service! Super happy staying here!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Just got back from my 8 day drip to California. Stayed in the Country Inn and Suites for two nights at the beginning of our trip. We wanted something down town San Diego, but the prices were prohibitive because of the parking charges. Any reasonably priced room became rediculous when you added on the $40-60 parking fees.
reviews.title: Best one Yet!

reviews.text: This was a Fantastic choice for the area. It only took us about 15 minutes to drive from down town San Diego to Country Inn. I have stayed at country inn and suites in every city between Texas and the East Coast. This was by far the best one. The room was immaculate with great sheets. There was plenty of space in the room to work and relax. Free Internet and cookies every night. There was always a fresh pot of coffee and jug of water in the lobby. The hotel had ample FREE parking and the staff was fantastic. The check in process was quick and the staff was extremely helpful in suggesting a fantastic place to eat. I needed a jacket and they gave me great directions to the nearest shopping.
reviews.title: Great staff equals great stay.
Nice hotel and large pool
reviews.text: Do Not hesitate to book this hotel, you will be very pleased.

I stayed here for 4 nights at the end of May. My stay was wonderful and exceeded my expectations. The staff at this hotel goes the extra mile to make sure your stay is as enjoyable as possible. Every request I had has taken care of quickly. The rooms are nicely appointed, the pool area is wonderful and the free breakfast was one of the best I've had in a long time. The only place I saw for improvement here was that the hall ways to the rooms were kind of poorly lit and could probably use a paint job but with all the good things about this hotel I would stay here again in a heart beat.
reviews.title: Nice hotel! for familys
Nice hotel.
reviews.text: We stayed here as part of a Las Vegas, San Diego, LA family trip. The suite we stayed in was nice and clean. The staff was super friendly and of course the free cookies in the lobby were a hit. Even though it was only in the 60's the pool and hot tub was nice and warm. We would definitely stay here again. The only reason for the 4 star is the location is it seems the hotel is probably located for the business traveler as it is near many business parks. However, we went for morning walks and even though in an office park area it was still quite nice. Breakfast was good.

reviews.title: Decent
reviews.text: This hotel is decent for the price. The redeeming factor is large and hearty breakfast, which consists of powdered eggs, rotating meat choice (bacon, sausage patties, bacon, sausage links) and a misc. side item (French toast, biscuits and gravy, fried potatoes). There is also a waffle iron thing that I kept forgetting about, but it looked good.

reviews.title: Comfortable hotel, great staff, good service.
reviews.text: The rooms are simple, the bed comfortable, and the bathrooms clean. I wish there was a mini-fridge, but I was able to do without. I was not impressed by the front desk staff, even for a hotel of this category and class. They were not very upfront about the rather large deposit charge they preauthorize on your card. Maybe I’m just too sensitive about my money being tied up by someone other than me, but they should have a sign stating that or tell you when you give your card at check-in. I brought it up to the front desk supervisor and he just shrugged it off as if it didn’t concern him. Not that there was anything they could personally do about it (corporate policy, I understand), but I was not impressed with that reaction. I would have been satisfied with an understanding nod or a super small apology, you know?

reviews.title: second time a charm!!
reviews.text: This hotel is comfortable, clean and staffed with helpful and knowledgeable front desk personnel. The breakfast staff was wonderful also. The menu over four days was varied, and great care given to keep the buffet restocked with all items, hot and cold. The hotel is located in a safe area and easily accessed from a freeway. My husband and I were visiting San Diego for a vacation and the next time we return to San Diego we will choose this particular hotel again. Great stay.

reviews.title: Great service, clean comfortable rooms & free breakfast
reviews.text: after giving the carlson a poor review last year titled(accessible room beware)i logged into tripadvisor to see what the reviews are now, and was glad to read nothing but good to great reviews of the facility,so i went ahead and thought i would give them another try, boy was i glad i did! i ended up getting two rooms! upon arriving we were greeted and given all the information needed to enjoy our stay thanks to the hotel management and staff!,the rooms were great we had a nice view,beds were comfy, all linens were clean my hat's off to the cleaning crew they knocked this one outta the park, the breakfast in the morning has alot to offer, none of that continental breakfast here, way too much to list! both hot and cold breakfast.the place is in top shape! how can i keep that past review up!! i guess i should so we can all tell that the CARLSON INN& SUITES really do care about us,and would do anything to make it right,to every horror story this one had a very happy ending! looking forward to coming back!!

We have never stayed at this hotel chain before and are looking forward to staying in the future. Thanks to all the TripAdvisor reviewers for the rec! We went to SD to take our kids to the beach, Legoland, SeaWorld and to look around Old Town SD.
reviews.title: Very happy with our stay!

reviews.text: We stayed in a King suite. The kids slept on the sofabed and a crib in the living room area and we slept in the bedroom. All the King suites are by the elevator and or across from the ice machine. At first I was afraid this would be an issue with our kids in terms of the elevator chime, but it didn't bother them at all. You could hear the chime in the living room area, but it wasn't that loud. The entire suite was spacious and we made use of the refrigerator and microwave.
reviews.title: Great start to our vacation

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The entire hotel seemed pretty updated. The only place that seemed a little old was the bathrooms because there was paint peeling.
reviews.title: Raised my expectations for all hotels.

reviews.text: The complementary breakfast was terrific. Hot choices (waffles, eggs, bacon, sausage, oatmeal, changes by day) and cold choices (juices, milk, cereal, fruit, variety of bread/muffins/donuts) were great.
reviews.title: staying here for good!!
Good hotel close to major highways and businesses
reviews.text: This hotel seemed to cater to mainly business people, but since it was a holiday week (4th of July), there were plenty of families as well.

This was the best mid-level business hotel I've stayed in for a very long time. Friendly check in staff at the desk, clean, nice size rooms, comfortable beds, everything was absolutely perfect. There's complimentary coffee, water, and fruit in the lobby all day (and cookies too in the evening!), and one of the best breakfast buffets I've seen in a "breakfast included" hotel - make your own waffles, hot oatmeal, scrambled eggs, potatoes, and bacon, fresh fruit salad, and a variety of pastries, juices, bread, etc. The outdoor swimming pool was nice and warm, which was really nice when you're there in cool April weather.
reviews.title: Great hotel, great price, & clean!

reviews.text: We chose this hotel for its proximity to La Jolla, and were very pleased by the easy (10-15 minute) drive and the very reasonable prices compared to other hotels in the area. It is a little further from Sea World and downtown attractions, but only 20-30 minute drive, easily worth it for such a nice hotel at a great price!
reviews.title: nice play to stay and reasonable, too

reviews.text: I stayed here last weekend while in San Diego for a family reunion. I was very pleased how comfortable, quiet and clean it was, especially for the reasonable price. The front desk staff were helpful and unflappable, too.
reviews.title: Great Surprise!
Nice clean safe
reviews.text: i had never heard of the country inn and suites chain before, and when in hotwire got this hotel i was nervous about what was i going to get, i read some reviews here and that calmed me, but when i get there, i was very surprised to see a very nice hotel, with great rooms, perfect location and a great service. i went son san antonio the next summer and of course i went and stayed in a country inn and suits also... and again GREAT CHAIN!!! keep it up!

A nice, clean, safe hotel in a business area. Nice lobby and nice rooms. Nothing too fancy or extravagant but rooms are a good size and bathrooms do the job. We decided to stay here rather than pay to park in downtown and it was more than sufficient. Very nice breakfast, free parking and Internet.
reviews.title: Nice hotel - Close to many attractions

reviews.text: I have reservation for a month stay at this hotel. I checked in late but, the administrator copied all my personal data. When I try to pay part of my stay I was very surprised to find that my names (first name and surname) were mistaken. But the worst thing was that, the credit card registered to my room actually was not mine. It was very frustrating and I don't receive even apology. A couple days later the receptionist called me. She told me that even I have made pay with my credit card, the other card is still registered to my room. So she need to try re-register my card to my room again.
reviews.title: Very bad administration

aka: Country Inns & Suites By Carlson Hotel
